Class ObjectManager

java.lang.Object
com.goblinskeep.objects.ObjectManager
public class ObjectManager extends Object
Manages all interactive objects in the game.

Uses a HashMap to track objects where keys represent **map coordinates** (`x,y`). Stores objects like keys, traps, levers, exits, and bonuses. Provides methods to add, remove, and find objects dynamically.

  • Constructor Details

    • ObjectManager

      public ObjectManager(GamePanel gp)
      Constructs an ObjectManager that manages all game objects.
      Parameters:
      gp - The game panel instance.

  • Method Details

    • addObject

      public void addObject(int x, int y, MainObject newObject)
      Adds an object to the game world at the specified coordinates.
      Parameters:
      x - The object's x-coordinate in tile units.
      y - The object's y-coordinate in tile units.
      newObject - The object to be placed at this location.

    • findDoor

      public Exit findDoor()
      Searches the game world for the only Exit.
      Returns:
      The Exit object if found, or null if not found.

    • findLever

      public Lever findLever()
      Searches the game world for the only Lever object.
      Returns:
      The Lever object if found, otherwise null.

    • removeObject

      public void removeObject(int x, int y)
      Removes an object from the game world at the specified coordinates.
      Parameters:
      x - The x-coordinate (in pixels) of the object to remove.
      y - The y-coordinate (in pixels) of the object to remove.

    • draw

      public void draw(Graphics2D g2, GamePanel gp)
      Draws all objects currently in the game world by calling their corresponding draw methods
      Parameters:
      g2 - The graphics context used for rendering.
      gp - The game panel where objects are displayed.
